content.question: The position of an object moving in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is given by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t equals, 2 times t cubed, minus 3 times t squared, minus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="y of t equals, 2 times t cubed, minus 9 times t squared, plus 12 t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></math>. At what times <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the object at rest?

choices.label: <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
